title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

Currently, commits can pushed Bitbucket reference existing issue. issue exists code developed, please add issue first pushing. issue exists, need mention issue number (preceded hash symbol: #) commit description: Resolved #31 adding new function things, also updated documentation issue hash (.e. #31) preceded resolve, resolves, resolved, close, closes, closed, fix, fixes, fixed (capitalised ), Github automatically updated status issue(s) mentioned. current syntactical standard mention issue first provide short description committed changes relation issue. ancillary changes can mentioned comma.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hollway J (2025). autograph: Automatic Plotting Many Graphs. R package version 0.2.0, https://stocnet.github.io/autograph/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {autograph: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs},   author = {James Hollway},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://stocnet.github.io/autograph/}, }

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: package aims make exploration, analysis, publication results stocnet packages easier, faster, consistent. letting simply set theme, say institution, palettes used whenever use plot() graphr() object created one relevant packages.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: easy set theme. Just type stocnet_theme() see theme currently set, get list available themes. enter chosen theme name function set . plots created using autograph functions use theme, change .
code: library(autograph) library(patchwork) stocnet_theme() #> ℹ Theme is set to default. #> ℹ The following themes are available: default, bw, iheid, ethz, uzh, rug, unibe, crisp, neon, and rainbow. (plot(node_degree(ison_karateka)) +  plot(tie_betweenness(ison_karateka)))/ (plot(node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e")) +  plot(as_matrix(ison_southern_women),      membership = node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e"))) stocnet_theme("ethz") #> ✔ Theme set to ethz. (plot(node_degree(ison_karateka)) +  plot(tie_betweenness(ison_karateka)))/ (plot(node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e")) +  plot(as_matrix(ison_southern_women),      membership = node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e")))

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: autograph includes three one-line graphing functions sensible defaults based network’s properties.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: First, graphr() used graph networks manynet formats. includes sensible defaults researchers can view network’s structure distribution quickly minimum fuss. Compare output autograph similar default igraph:  autograph function recognises network two-mode network uses bipartite layout default, recognises network contains names nodes prints vertically legible layout. ‘clever’ features include automatic node sizing . contrast, igraph requires bipartite layout specified, cumbersome node size defaults smallest graphs, labels also often need resizing adjustment avoid overlap. autograph’s adjustments can overridden, however…

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: Changing size colors nodes ties easy specifying function’s relevant argument replacement, indicating attribute inherit information.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: autograph can use layout algorithms offered packages igraph, ggraph, graphlayouts, offers additional layout algorithms snapping layouts grid, visualising partitions horizontally, vertically, concentrically, conforming configurational coordinates.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: Second, graphs() used graph multiple networks together, can useful ego networks network panels. patchwork used help arrange individual plots together.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: Third, grapht() used visualise dynamic networks. uses gganimate gifski create gif visualises network changes time. really couldn’t easier.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: easiest way install latest stable version autograph via CRAN. Simply open R console enter: install.packages('autograph') library(autograph) load package make data tutorials (see ) contained within package available.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: latest development version, slightly earlier access new features testing, may wish download install binaries Github install source locally. latest binary releases major OSes – Windows, Mac, Linux – can found . Download appropriate binary operating system, install using adapted version following commands: Windows: install.packages("~/Downloads/autograph_winOS.zip", repos = NULL) Mac: install.packages("~/Downloads/autograph_macOS.tgz", repos = NULL) Unix: install.packages("~/Downloads/autograph_linuxOS.tar.gz", repos = NULL) install source latest main version autograph Github, please install remotes package CRAN : latest stable version: remotes::install_github("stocnet/autograph") latest development version: remotes::install_github("stocnet/autograph@develop")

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: using Mac computers may also install using Macports: sudo port install R-autograph

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: Development package funded Swiss National Science Foundation (SNSF) Grant Number 188976: “Power Networks Rate Change Institutional Complexes” (PANARCHIC).

what: Layouts for snapping layouts to a grid — depth_first_recursive_search
title: Layouts for snapping layouts to a grid — depth_first_recursive_search
text: function uses approximate pattern matching redistribute coarse layouts square grid points, preserving topological relationships among nodes (see Inoue et al. 2012).

title: Layouts for snapping layouts to a grid — depth_first_recursive_search
code: depth_first_recursive_search(layout)

title: Layouts for snapping layouts to a grid — depth_first_recursive_search
text: Inoue, Kentaro, Shinichi Shimozono, Hideaki Yoshida, Hiroyuki Kurata. 2012. “Application Approximate Pattern Matching Two Dimensional Spaces Grid Layout Biochemical Network Maps” edited J. Bourdon. PLoS ONE 7(6):e37739. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0037739 .

what: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition
title: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition
text: algorithms layout networks based two partitions, recommended use graphr() {ggraph}. Note layout algorithms use {Rgraphviz}, package available Bioconductor. first need downloaded using BiocManager::install("Rgraphviz"). already installed, prompt first time functions used though. "hierarchy" layout layers first node set along bottom, second node set along top, sequenced spaced necessary minimise edge overlap. "alluvial" layout similar "hierarchy", places successive layers horizontally rather vertically. "railway" layout similar "hierarchy", nodes aligned across layers. "ladder" layout similar "railway", places successive layers horizontally rather vertically. "concentric" layout places "hierarchy" layout around circle, successive layers appearing concentric circles. "multilevel" layout places successive layers multiple levels. "lineage" layout ranks nodes Y axis according values.

title: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition
code: layout_concentric(   .data,   membership,   radius = NULL,   order.by = NULL,   circular = FALSE,   times = 1000 )  layout_tbl_graph_concentric(   .data,   membership,   radius = NULL,   order.by = NULL,   circular = FALSE,   times = 1000 )  layout_multilevel(.data, level, circular = FALSE)  layout_tbl_graph_multilevel(.data, level, circular = FALSE)  layout_lineage(.data, rank, circular = FALSE)  layout_tbl_graph_lineage(.data, rank, circular = FALSE)  layout_hierarchy(.data, center = NULL, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_tbl_graph_hierarchy(   .data,   center = NULL,   circular = FALSE,   times = 1000 )  layout_alluvial(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_tbl_graph_alluvial(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_railway(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_tbl_graph_railway(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_ladder(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)  layout_tbl_graph_ladder(.data, circular = FALSE, times = 1000)

title: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition
text: Diego Diez, Andrew P. Hutchins Diego Miranda-Saavedra. 2014. "Systematic identification transcriptional regulatory modules protein-protein interaction networks". Nucleic Acids Research, 42 (1) e6.

title: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition
text: .data {manynet} compatible network data. membership node attribute vector draw concentric circles "concentric" layout. radius vector radii concentric circles located "concentric" layout. default equal placement around empty centre, unless one (core) single node, case node occupies centre graph. order.attribute label indicating (decreasing) order nodes around circles "concentric" layout. default ordering given bipartite placement reduces number edge crossings. circular layout transformed radial representation. possible layouts. Defaults FALSE. times Maximum number iterations, appropriate level node attribute vector hierarchically order levels "multilevel" layout. rank numerical node attribute place nodes Y axis according values "lineage" layout. center split "hierarchical" layouts declaring "center" argument "events", "actors", declaring node name hierarchy layout. Defaults NULL.

title: Layout algorithms based on bi- or other partitions — layout_partition
code: #graphr(ison_southern_women, layout = "concentric", membership = "type", #           node_color = "type", node_size = 3) #graphr(ison_lotr, layout = "multilevel", #           node_color = "Race", level = "Race", node_size = 3) # ison_adolescents %>% #   mutate(year = rep(c(1985, 1990, 1995, 2000), times = 2), #          cut = node_is_cutpoint(ison_adolescents)) %>% #   graphr(layout = "lineage", rank = "year", node_color = "cut", #              node_size = migraph::node_degree(ison_adolescents)*10) #graphr(ison_southern_women, layout = "hierarchy", center = "events", #           node_color = "type", node_size = 3) #graphr(ison_southern_women, layout = "alluvial")

title: Valence-based layout — layout_valence
text: Valence-based layout

title: Valence-based layout — layout_valence
code: layout_valence(   .data,   times = 500,   center = NULL,   circular = FALSE,   repulsion_coef = 1,   attraction_coef = 0.05 )  layout_tbl_graph_valence(   .data,   times = 500,   center = NULL,   circular = FALSE,   repulsion_coef = 1,   attraction_coef = 0.05 )

title: Valence-based layout — layout_valence
text: .data {manynet} compatible network data. times Integer sweeps algorithm pass . default 4. center, circular Extra parameters required {tidygraph} compatibility. repulsion_coef Coefficient global repulsion force. Default 1. attraction_coef Coefficient edge-based attraction/repulsion force. Default 0.05.

title: Valence-based layout — layout_valence
code: edges <- data.frame(   from = c("A", "B", "C", "D"),   to   = c("B", "C", "D", "A"),   weight = c(2, 3, 1, 4),   sign = c(1, -1, 1, -1)  # 1 = positive, -1 = negative   ) graphr(as_igraph(edges), layout="valence")

what: Easily graph networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphr
title: Easily graph networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphr
text: function provides users easy way graph (m)network data exploration, investigation, inspiration, communication. builds upon {ggplot2} {ggraph} offer pretty extensible graphing solutions. However, compared solutions, graphr() contains various algorithms provide better looking graphs default. means just passing function network data often sufficient return reasonable-looking graph. function also makes easy modify many commonly adapted aspects graph, including node edge size, colour, shape, arguments rather additional functions need remember. can defined outright, e.g. node_size = 8, reference attribute network, e.g. node_size = "wealth". Lastly, graphr() uses {ggplot2}-related theme information, easy make colour palette fonts institution-specific consistent. See e.g. theme_iheid() . learn can done visually, try run_tute("Visualisation").

title: Easily graph networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphr
code: graphr(   .data,   layout,   labels = TRUE,   node_color,   node_shape,   node_size,   node_group,   edge_color,   edge_size,   snap = FALSE,   ...,   node_colour,   edge_colour )

title: Easily graph networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphr
text: .data manynet-consistent object. layout igraph, ggraph, manynet layout algorithm. declared, defaults "triad" networks 3 nodes, "quad" networks 4 nodes, "stress" one mode networks, "hierarchy" two mode networks. "hierarchy" layout, one can split graph declaring "center" argument "events", "actors", declaring node name. "concentric" layout algorithm please declare "membership" extra argument. "membership" argument expects either quoted node attribute present data vector length nodes draw concentric circles. "multilevel" layout algorithm please declare "level" extra argument. "level" argument expects either quoted node attribute present data vector length nodes hierarchically order categories. "level" missing, function look 'lvl' node attribute data. "lineage" layout ranks nodes Y axis according values. "lineage" layout algorithm please declare "rank" extra argument. "rank" argument expects either quoted node attribute present data vector length nodes. labels Logical, whether print node names labels present. node_color, node_colour Node variable used coloring nodes. easiest added node attribute graph plotting. Nodes can also colored declaring color instead. node_shape Node variable used shaping nodes. easiest added node attribute graph plotting. Nodes can also shaped declaring shape instead. node_size Node variable used sizing nodes. can continuous variable nodes network. Since function expects existing variable, recommended calculate node-related statistics prior using function. Nodes can also sized declaring numeric size vector instead. node_group Node variable used grouping nodes. easiest added hull groups plotting. Group variables minimum 3 nodes, less, number groups reduced merging categories lower counts one called "". edge_color, edge_colour Tie variable used coloring nodes. easiest added edge tie attribute graph plotting. Edges can also colored declaring color instead. edge_size Tie variable used sizing edges. can continuous variable nodes network. Since function expects existing variable, recommended calculate edge-related statistics prior using function. Edges can also sized declaring numeric size vector instead. snap Logical scalar, whether layout snapped grid. ... Extra arguments pass layout algorithm, necessary.

title: Easily graph networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphr
text: ggplot2::ggplot() object. last plot can saved file system using ggplot2::ggsave().

title: Easily graph networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphr
code: graphr(ison_adolescents)  ison_adolescents %>%   mutate(color = rep(c("introvert","extrovert"), times = 4),          size = ifelse(node_is_cutpoint(ison_adolescents), 6, 3)) %>%   mutate_ties(ecolor = rep(c("friends", "acquaintances"), times = 5)) %>%   graphr(node_color = "color", node_size = "size",          edge_size = 1.5, edge_color = "ecolor")

title: Easily graph a set of networks with sensible defaults — plot_graphs

However, uses {patchwork} package plot graphs side side , necessary, successive rows. useful lists networks represent, example, ego component subgraphs network, list network's different types tie across time. default just first last network plotted, can overridden "waves" parameter. graphs network (nodes), graphs may share layout facilitate comparison. default, successive graphs use layout calculated "first" network, options include "last" layout, mix, "", .

Additional arguments passed graphr().

title: Many themes — theme_set
text: function enables plots quickly, easily consistently themed. achieved setting theme option enables appropriate palette used autograph-consistent plotting methods. following themes currently available: default, bw, iheid, ethz, uzh, rug, unibe, crisp, neon, rainbow.

title: Many themes — theme_set
code: stocnet_theme(theme = NULL)

title: Many themes — theme_set
text: theme String naming theme. default "default". string can capitalised .

title: Many themes — theme_set
text: function sets theme palette(s) used across stocnet packages. palettes written options held .

title: Many themes — theme_set
code: stocnet_theme("default") #> ✔ Theme set to default. plot(manynet::node_degree(ison_karateka))  stocnet_theme("rug") #> ✔ Theme set to rug. plot(manynet::node_degree(ison_karateka))

title: Many themes — theme_themes
text: functions enable graphs easily quickly themed, e.g. changing default colour graph's vertices edges.

title: Many themes — theme_themes
text: base_size Font size, default 12. base_family Font family, default "sans".

title: Many themes — theme_themes
code: to_mentoring(ison_brandes) %>%   mutate(color = c(rep(c(1,2,3), 3), 3)) %>%   graphr(node_color = "color") +   labs(title = "Who leads and who follows?") +   scale_color_iheid() +   theme_iheid() #> Scale for colour is already present. #> Adding another scale for colour, which will replace the existing scale.

title: autograph 0.2.0
text: Added (currently) necessary dependencies Removed unnecessary manynet dependencies

title: autograph 0.2.0
text: Added graphr(), graphs(), grapht() manynet quick plotting one graphs Improved +.ggplot() check whether second object inherits ggplot class (thanks @teunbrand fixing #110) Fixed issue edge_linetype signed, directed networks weights (closed #14) Updated README examples graphr() others

title: autograph 0.2.0
text: Added themes Oxford UNIGE (closed #1) Improved stocnet_theme() add option “stocnet_theme” (previously “snet_theme”) Added is_dark() check whether theme dark light Added match_color() return closest matching colors palette

title: autograph 0.2.0
text: Added layout_valence() signed graphs (closed #6) Added configurational layouts manynet Added aliases various layout_tbl_graph_*() functions
